p:
The ongoing global crisis COVID-19 (Coronavirus disease-2019) is caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2). It was first reported in Wuhan city, China in December 2019 and rapidly spread to many regions of the world.
1 The most common symptoms are fever, fatigue, sore throat, dry cough, myalgia, and dyspnea. Less common symptoms are headache, dizziness, abdominal pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.
2 However, asymptomatic cases have also been reported in many countries. As of 11 August 2020, 20.25 million people have been infected and 738,937 deaths reported by the pandemic outbreak of COVID-19.
